Package controller

Class Dashboard

java.lang.Object
controller.Dashboard
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class Dashboard extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class defines the functionality of the dashboard screen.

  • Method Details

    • onActionCreateCustomer

      public void onActionCreateCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method prepares the details panel to accept user input to add a customer.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The customer-table create button is pressed.

    • onActionDeleteCustomer

      public void onActionDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method deletes a selected customer.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The customer-table delete button is pressed.

    • onActionCreateAppointment

      public void onActionCreateAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method prepares the details panel to accept user input to add an appointment.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The appointment-table create button is pressed.

    • onActionDeleteAppointment

      public void onActionDeleteAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method deletes a selected appointment.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The appointment-table delete button is pressed.

    • onActionSave

      public void onActionSave(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method saves the values of all fields in the details panel. This method checks a "state" condition to determine which query method to call.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The save button is pressed.

    • onActionReset

      public void onActionReset(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method resets the values of all fields in the details panel. This method checks a "state" condition to determine how to re-initialize the values.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The reset button is pressed.

    • onActionAll

      public void onActionAll(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method displays all appointments in the appointments table.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "All" radio button is pressed.

    • onActionMonth

      public void onActionMonth(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method displays all appointments within the next month in the appointments able.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Monthly" radio button is pressed.

    • onActionWeek

      public void onActionWeek(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method displays all appointments within the next week in the appointments able.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Weekly" radio button is pressed.

    • onActionAssociated

      public void onActionAssociated(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method displays all appointments associated with the selected customer in the appointments table.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Associated" radio button is pressed.

    • onActionGenerateReport

      public void onActionGenerateReport(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method displays the reports screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The generate reports button is pressed.

    • onActionExit

      public void onActionExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method terminates the application.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The exit button is pressed.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the dashboard screen.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - Location of root-object.
      resourceBundle - Root-object localization resources.

    • initializeDetails

      public void initializeDetails()
      This method hides all labels and fields in the details panel until a customer or appointment is selected.

    • appointmentDetails

      public void appointmentDetails()
      This method displays only the fields and labels necessary within the details panel to view and edit appointment information.

    • customerDetails

      public void customerDetails()
      This method displays only the fields and labels necessary within the details panel to view and edit customer information.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      This method clears all fields in the details panel.

    • conflictCheckerAdd

      public boolean conflictCheckerAdd(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, int customerID)
      This method checks whether a user-created appointment will conflict with existing appointments.
      Parameters:
      start - The start date and time input by the user.
      end - The end and date time input by the user.
      customerID - The customer ID selected by the user.
      Returns:
      conflict A boolean condition indicating the presence of a schedule conflict.

    • conflictCheckerUpdate

      public boolean conflictCheckerUpdate(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, int customerID, int appointmentID)
      This method checks whether a user-modified appointment will conflict with existing appointments. This method excludes the existing appointment of the same appointment ID.
      Parameters:
      start - The start date and time (un)modified by the user.
      end - The end and date time (un)modified by the user.
      customerID - The customer ID selected by the user.
      appointmentID - The appointment ID of the (un)modified appointment.
      Returns:
      conflict A boolean condition indicating the presence of a schedule conflict.
